reviews.review_msg: Took Sex Talk online & this instructor doesn't have a clear outline for projects. She marks you on how well you understand how to do the assignment rather than how well you understand the course material. 80% of the time when doing your projects you are guessing what the 3 prompts you are given means, rather than actually spending it on researching

Super easy class! There are 2 assignments per week: ONE multiple choice or true or false question, and then a reflection about the readings/lectures! I found this class super interesting. I liked how she structured it so it made me feel more interested in learning more about the topics. The only thing that is super heavy on your grade are the exams
Dr. Leung helped me so much in this course and was very flexible. Great professor for a great class.

Helen is an amazing professor. This course is very easy, yet is still very interesting and relevant to today's world. All of the tests are open book and she gives you a lot of time to complete them. The weekly assignments are also extremely easy and fast to complete. Easy GPA booster !!

I highly recommend taking GSWS 100! It is a very easy course with interesting topics. There are very small and easy assignments weekly, a midterm and final. Most of the lectures have TV shows and movies that are incorporated. Even though it was an online asynchronous course, Helen made the it very easy to navigate on Canvas.

I had Helen in Fall 2022. Her lectures are interesting and engaging and the tutorials were too. The material covered in class is directly relevant to the exams and marking was very generous. We even got tea and coffee for our ten minute break during lectures. Overall very enjoyable course with interesting topics and a very good, organized prof!

Great professor! The lectures were engaging and I like that she shows film clips and an interest in media. My TA Spender was wonderful, they really put in effort in tutorials and marked very fairly. Assignments and readings were fair and not difficult. Class avg was B or B-, would recommend anyone interested to take this course.
really great!! personally i had the best TA in the world who was mostly who taught me tbh. but Dr.Leung is very sweet i absolutely recommend

Professor Leung was so great to have this semester. Her lectures were engaging, she was super caring about her students and provided us with coffee/tea every week. The material was easy, the TAs were very good and graded us fairly.

Professor Leung is so kind and patient, she tries to make concepts as clear as possible. I'm almost sad to have taken this class in my first year because I can't experience it again and I still have a long way to go. I would totally recommend this class. 
I want to clarify that attending lectures was not mandatory, but tutorial attendance was.

Helen is so amazing. Best Prof I've ever had. She cares about her students, her lectures are clear and to the point, the class is so interesting. Online open book midterm and final, all written but straight forward. No textbook, just weekly small readings that are so interesting. She set out coffee and tea for our class. I want to change my major.

Its my first semester in university, and its definitely overwhelming, however Helen literally makes getting up in the morning worth it. She is an amazing lecturer, and goes over things in a way that engaging and extremely thorough. The TA's, mine specifically was named Hannah, is so kind, and definitely a fair grader. Overall, amazing class.

Made class material and lectures very accessible. Lecture outlines summarized main points in the readings ( so you could get away with not reading the entire article) assignments were very straightforward. I felt bad for her to be honest because the class I was in had a lot of immature first years that were disrespectful she handled it super well.

She is a great prof, really approachable and ready to help with any questions. The class was great and there were a lot of readings (do them). She relies on them throughout her lectures, but she summarizes them and makes the material for the specific lecture more engaging and easier to understand.

She is a kind proff with a fun relatable personality. Helens lecture concepts are interesting but the lectures themselves not so much. For a 100 level class it is actually a lot harder than expected. requires a lot of work each week to do well. personally, this is not a GPA booster.

Seems kind and caring, but shes a bit of a bad lecturer. The content is interesting and you can tell she clearly knows her stuff but it feels all over the place and you find yourself losing focus. She does provide a lecture outline so you can follow along, but its hard to pay attention. Not the worst prof though.

Professor Leung is a very kind lecturer who noticeably cares about her students. I loved how her class was structured for remote learning - class was asynchronous but was still developed as a whole to not feel "alone" in your learning. She was always available for extra help, as was my TA, and assignments/tests were well explained.
Lectures were amazing! Adapted well to everything being online. Midterms and finals were very straightforwards.

Helen is one of my favourite professors at SFU. She has adapted well to the online environment. Her lectures are informative, but broken down into easy-to-understand chunks. She is such a sweet person, and her weekly AMA's are helpful if you have a few clarifying questions, but are afraid of attending office hours. 4-6 hours/week is pretty typical.
Lectures are very interesting, interactive and with lots of relevant videos/clips. Good lecturer and material. Exams are fairly easy and based entirely on the readings.
TA has complete control of your grade rather than her. Takes at least 3 weeks (up to a month) to get your grades back. Lectures are good.

She's a really good teacher but this class isn't a grade booster, you need too read all the articles and I honestly would forget everything really easily probably won't do well but I don't think that should make you not want to take the course because I learned a lot
She herself is super inspiring, for a 100 level course, the midterm and final were VERY hard.

Her lectures are interestingly fun but sometimes she just reads off her powerpoint outline. The exam questions seemed easy but our TA marked our midterm extremely hard. The final was a long take home exam so do your readings weekly. Class was enjoyable overall but your grades will depend entirely on your TA so communicate religiously with her/him.

Really nice and always open to questions! Lectures are important because she further explains a lot of the stuff that is in the notes she posts on canvas, but the content isn't too difficult, and it's really interesting.

Super friendly, clear and professional lecturer. Can clearly see her passion and interest in the subject without bias. Go to lecture, keep up with the material and you should be able to do fairly well.
ta marked extremely hard and unfair. course was interesting but not as easy as it seemed. i worked hard and my mark did not show for it whatsoever.

Helen is an amazing prof, she knows her stuff and is always willing to help her students better understand the material. Questions were encouraged in class and she marks fair, what you put in is what you get out. Textbook readings are relevant to the weekly topics and are super interesting. Would definitely take another class with her.

Professor Leung is a fantastic lecturer. Since I was a 4th year taking a 100 level class I didn't get to interact with her as much as I would of liked, but I will definitely take a class with her again. She was very kind, helpful and understanding if you every needed to talk to her and totally whipped my TA into shape! It was much appreciated.

Expectations were very unclear for the paper and exams. 2 of 3 books were required for the class but ended up not necessary to read. Each week lecture slides are about 6 slides long - slides lacked detail. On the other hand, lectures were very entertaining, interesting and engaging.

I LOVED HER. Take her course! She and the TAs were so helpful with their consistent feedback! As a first year student, this online course was a great way to familiarize myself with canvas, discussion boards, and how university works. I have all good things to say about Dr. Shearman. Definitely would take her course again!
Would take a class again, always there to answer questions and can be quite funny.

Reema is a kind person and is always open/asks for feedback. there were quite a few papers on top of weekly readings but overall course material was interesting and she gave grace periods for all assignments. she also gives guides for the weekly readings and viewings which are helpful to understand the course content
